reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my husband chose the Suite Princess for our honeymoon in Feb this year. We chose it because of its excellent reviews on food variety and quality, its quiet location and older guests (therefore less yobs!) and all were as expected, food was fabulous and never ran out no matter what time you decided to eat. There are no bars nearby but the bars in the hotel are decent, sports bar was nice and cool with sports on all day.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel but beware the smokers!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I won't go over old ground, most reviews say the same, the one thing that was really horrid was relaxing by the pool, with a book and sangria... only to be surrounded by smoke.. i am not a massive anti smoker but people should not be smoking on their sun loungers, there should be a designated smoking area. I know not everyone will agree to this but its just my opinion!
reviews.title: I don't understand the moaners. Ignore them. This is a wonderful hotel for a great relaxing child free holiday.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got a free upgrade which was lovely, slippers, robe, water, wine and choccys, all very nice.
reviews.title: Good All Inclusive Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Even though we chose this hotel because we didn't want to be surrounded by drunk yobs all week, some of the more mature guests were extremely rude but the staff managed them very well.
reviews.title: Great Hotel but Spoiled By smokers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitely recommend this hotel,a beautfil hotel and the food itself is worth a trip back there!
reviews.title: Good vfm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this hotel because it is adults only and we wanted a quiet break in the sun. What we got was a lovely room with views but although it had been refurbished was still lacking in some areas such as the bathroom where you had to step into a slippery bath to have a shower. We were upgraded so had the use of a kettle but the only place to plug it in was at floor level across the other side of the room or remove a lamp plug by the side table!
reviews.title: Somewhat disappointing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant was a big disappointment and can only be described as a noisy canteen. There was plenty of choice and the food looked very appetising however on occasions it was not properly cooked even from the show cooking. When the hotel is full there are 600 guests but the dining room can only accommodate 400 so there were queues if you arrived late.
reviews.title: good 4 star , was as we expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a lovely pool area which is spoilt by having the sun beds too close together. Although you can walk into the shallow end there is quite a step down so you have to be careful not to slip. A hand rail would improve things. The animacion team were fantastic - always happy and encouraging. I'm not one for joining in generally but I did on this occasion and really enjoyed it. It was something to do besides sunbathing and replaced the lack of walks around the hotel.
reviews.title: Very good and large bedrooms rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took the hotel bus into Puerto Mogan one day but be aware that you are dropped off at the top of the Plaza and it is a long walk down to the harbour! We returned for the Friday market but this time used a taxi which dropped us in the town centre. You must haggle over anything you want to buy otherwise things are overpriced. Mind you I did pick up a few nice things but mainly from the shops.
reviews.title: Good, but not 5 Star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also took a mini bus trip up into the mountains. This is not a trip for anyone who doesn't like heights as there are some narrow roads with tight bends and no crash barriers! We really enjoyed the amusing commentary by the lead driver who was English and the scenery was amazing.
reviews.title: good holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent another enjoyable week here again at the beginning of January . Didn't feel the need to upgrade as room & drink were sufficient for us. Went to the market on Friday on the hotel bus (you can book from the Wednesday to reserve your seat ) in Porto Mogan & found lots to buy -worth a visit as it is a very pretty area. Went on the local bus to Playa Amadores & found the sea calmer & the beach nicer than Taurito. Last year there had been a storm & the beach in Taurito had a lot of huge stones on it brought in by the waves .but this year much better with lots of dark sand . We had one cloudy day but the rest was sunny. Any questions please ask .
reviews.title: As good as last year

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ]Just arrived back from a week in Gran Canaria. Weather was lovely considering it was the middle of January, nice to get away from the cold weather in England...
reviews.title: Very Lovely Hotel..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself I cant find anything to fault on.... Everything was well decorated and rooms were extremely spacious.... Food was fine although we did feel it started to become a bit repetitive by the end of the week, but I guess that’s to be expected. I wouldn’t recommend this place for anyone under the age of 40 personally, as we did feel out of place as there was a much older crowd.... which thinking back I should have expected being an Adults Only resort.. The shows were very good and all the staff worked very hard...
reviews.title: An enjoyable holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very good holiday overall and we may return in 20 years time or so…. When we will fit in a bit better :)
reviews.title: Lovely hotel with great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a week at the 4**** Suite Princess in Playa Taurito , the hotel has an attractive appearance with good sized bedrooms ,all with a balcony and sea view. The rooms are kept very clean and the twin beds are comfortable .The hotel is all inclusive but this just covers the food and drinks, things like a safe (12 euros a week )a fridge, kettle, WiFi (9 euros a day ) and sun loungers on your balcony are all extras. You can upgrade to black wristbands (I think it is 16 euros a day each) gives you the extras plus branded drinks and bottled wine.
reviews.title: Excellent adults-only hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Purpose of Holiday: Mum and two daughters celebrating eldest's 21st (you don't have to be a 'couple' - I'm a single parent (divorced) taking her two daughters on holiday for a week and I wasn't the only holidaymaker in similar circumstances).
reviews.title: To be recommended: A great relaxing holiday in a lovely location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in at Hotel: No problems bearing in mind there was a lot of people in front of us. Informative and staff are polite with good English (just have to listen carefully).
reviews.title: Ticked All The Right Boxes for Us

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Client-base: For the week we were there - and this review is only about that one week - the age ranges varied from young to old, albeit the majority were couples. The only criteria for this hotel is that you a) need to be able to pay for it and b) be 16+ years old. The only thing missing was children, but that was the objective of staying at an adults only hotel (I want a break before grandchildren come along in about 10 years time and I'm a teacher ;-). Hotel looked busy so there is obviously a market for this. Nationality varies from English to Finnish to Dutch etc. etc. (after May it will be mainly English and Irish, I'm led to believe).
reviews.title: Excellent service, very quiet location, perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011
reviews.text: Location: Lovely and peaceful - there is more in the resort than I initially thought (even a disco, although we didn't have the need to go and a small waterpark (14 E for day pass for adults 5E for children) which I do believe will belong to the hotel next door and become one of First Choice's 'Splash' Hotels in November). No real 'walks'. Not much in the way of shops. TIP! Go to P/Mogan 10 mins away. Catch the hotel courtesy bus (get ticket from Reception on Wed. am first come first served). Leaves at 10, returns at 1 pm) or the no. 1 bus (1.30 E) or taxi c.6E. Walk to the market - only on FRIDAYS - some tat there but also genuine Canary goods. It's a haggle market (looky, looky, looky, you buy ;-) Assuming you don't want to buy a firm 'no' sorts that out ;-) Whilst you are there, you can catch a boat trip to go along the coast, although we didn't do this.
reviews.title: Lovely relaxing holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel: Stylish hotel with grey/brown furnishings in public areas (lacks colour). From reading this site it has had a makeover - obviously by someone who is colour-blind (I jest, it was trendy looking). Seating in public areas aren't comfortable, particularly where the entertainment takes place (white tub chairs - trendy but uncomfortable for an evening's entertainment). Toilets were clean and smelt lovely - I do notice things like this because dirty facilities is a definate no, no to me. We found this hotel clean and tidy for the week we were there.
reviews.title: Amazing!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just had one week staying at the Suite Princess. The suites are huge, very clean and with a good view. We stayed on the 9th floor in room 9021, only thing I didn't like was that the maid kept moving my personal things around. I left some bit and pieces out on the table and desk where I wanted it and she obviously didn't like where I put things - whenever I went back to the room I had to find where she had moved things to. I found my body buff in the bidet. VERY ANNONYING. I know I should have said something to the manager but at the same time I didn;t want to get her into trouble. We are not really keen on buffet meals but we never got tired of the food, it was varied and to a very high standard. Tables were cleared very quickly and the staff were very friendly. Wine and beer on tap all day. You can upgrade to a black wrist band to get served better qualtiy wine etc, sun beds on balcony, dressing gown and a few other bits but we didn't think it was worth the extra. Especially as the sun didn't get to out balcony until very late afternoon. The entertainment was OK - depends what you like really. There is a young English duo who are very good but I did get a bet fed up with the same songs over and over again.
reviews.title: Clean, well kept, good staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not much to do in Taurito, we took the free shuttle bus into Mogan a couple of time. Went to the Friday market, yes there is some tat there but I was very pleased with picking up a couple of bargains from the shops - it seemed to me they reduced their prices on market day.
reviews.title: Comfort, Peace and Quiet - Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all a good holiday, it served it's purpose - good food and drink (plenty of it) and sunshine. Would go back if I wanted to get some winter sunshine.
reviews.title: Five star service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Situated overlooking a small bay this hotel is the perfect place for couples, although not young ones. The rooms are excellent, see my tip below. The staff are extremely friendly without being in your face. The hotel is kept immaculately clean, our towels were changed every day and the bed linen once during our week's stay. The greatest plus for this hotel is no children under the age of 16 - yippee! Avoid the Welcome meeting as it is simply a sales pitch by the reps and very annoying.
reviews.title: suite princess

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort itself is a little tired and there are a number of abandoned building projects - sign of the times I suppose, but this doesn't have to detract from the experience.
reviews.title: A well run hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: nice location to have a winterbreak
reviews.title: winterbreak

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: unfortunately we were forced to have silvester dinner at6pm
reviews.title: Average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is not a four star hotel but it's nice anyway. The public areas are kept up to date but the rooms needs renovation. They are spacious but the beds are uncomfortable and the furiture are worn down. There are only elevators in the middle of the building and we got a room at the very end of a corridor and that ment a lot of walking. If you are disabled it's not easy to access the beach. The hotel should have an entrence at the same level as the restaurant with an elevator to avoid this problem.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel Relaxing Holiday and no Kids

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Most of the staff is nice and polite and works hard. We only had one argument with the reception but most of the staff there where helpful.
reviews.title: Great Hotel but not for walkers.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food is not of our taste. But there were a lot to choose from and different dishes everyday. Everything taste the same thou and the oil they use is on everything.
reviews.title: Not Worth IT

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely Hotel, fabulous views, great animation team go Monique and Ana!. Drinks are all self service it is hard to find a barman in the day. You have to pay extra for safe deposit, fridge, mini bar etc, it is 9 euros a day for internet connection 29 for a week!!! a rip off!. You collect "warm" bottles of water from Reception. There is no waiter service unless you chose to eat in La Choza Restaurant with a set menue. Food is very good, fresh, plenty of choice and well displayed. The main restaurant is busy at 8.00pm so go at 7.00pm when it opens! Enjoy the Cava reception on the terrace. It is very very quiet. Taurito has just a water park, disco and few souvenirs shops nowhere to really walk for the evening. Sunbeds are all nabbed fairly early but talk to the lifeguard and he will get more sunbeds or just move the towels as the hotel has a no booked sunbed policy! Although Thomson 5T it doesnt really warrant that a 4 more likely. If you can upgrade please do as it is so much nicer, branded free drinks, bottles of wine, fridge, tea/coffee, safe all included and the special things like slippers, robes, fruit, it is worth it. Trips out and about are very expensive. We hired a car for 30 euros from the car hire below the hotel and had a lovely day out. Very hot there too and as it is couples it has a stately feel and very friendly. Dress for dinner long trousers only gentlemen! Entertainment etc is entertaining if you enjoy laughing. All in all a really nice holiday.
reviews.title: Peaceful Oasis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I read lots of reviews of this hotel after we had booked it (a one week stay with Thomson) and was quite concerned at some of the things I had read. However having returned I have concluded that some people really need to stop taking things so seriously! We had a fantastic relaxing week in the sun in a great location right by the beach.
reviews.title: Exactly what we'd hoped for

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All the rooms face the sea and have wonderful views, and they get the evening sun which is a big bonus. I have stayed in a number of hotels where the view has been of a rock face if you don't pay the supplement and to have such a wonderful setting was great.
reviews.title: Ignore the Moaners

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We thought the food was more than adequate, with a huge amount of choice at breakfast, lunch and dinner. We have definitely come back heavier than when we left! If you're a young couple (we're 25) then it's worth bearing in mind that the hotel is full of retired people, but this just means that it's more peaceful than your average, so if that's what you're after, this is the place to go.
reviews.title: fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The activities team are great-really friendly and enthusiastic, but not at all pushy in getting you involved in things. The evening entertainment was for the most part good-definitely entertaining if not always brilliant, but if you're looking for brilliance, don't go to an all inclusive hotel and expect to find it there!
reviews.title: Does exactly what it says on the tin...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from the Suite Princess, Taurito. A very nice hotel on the beach in the bay. The rooms were very spacious with a lovely view from our room on the 6th floor (6011). We cannot fault either the staff (very caring) and the food (excellent). There was evening entertainment every night, some good, some mediocre but we enjoyed the 'Elvis' night most of all.There were always more than sufficient sunbeds, towel swap available and the whole hotel is run very professionally. We did not see any used plates, glasses or bowls lying around as they were cleared as soon as discarded, with no fuss. All the waiters/waitresses were very on the ball.
reviews.title: Nice one

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't know whether the upgrade is worth it as most of the extras are available in the dining room (apart from dressing gown/slippers). We didn't know they had 'black armband' rooms as well, as when I asked about the upgrade on our arrival, I was told I would still have to remain in the allocated room. Perhaps there were no more 'black armband rooms left.
reviews.title: Comfortable, not luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Thomson reps were there whenever you needed them for information etc. and had the brilliant idea of a 'swap box' in their room for guests to discard any tan lotions, shampoo etc. for the benefit of those coming to the end of their holiday and just needing a little bit of toothpaste or something. We were reallly glad of it on our last couple of days for a few bits and discarded our own bodywash etc. when we left. Well done Gemma & Adam. I would certainly recommend this hotel to friends.
reviews.title: bit like my school report ...could do better.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was advertised as 4T by Thomsons and we paid for an upgrade for our trip which, we expected, would add some extra 'little touches' to that luxury. Although the hotel was clean,comfortable and the food was very good we felt it was, at best, a 3* hotel. The 'extras' we received for an extra £260 for the week were a bottle of wine and some fruit in our room on arrival, bathrobes that were too small for me to wear and past their best anyway, a slightly larger room and larger television than the standard room. The upgrade also allowed us to be served named brand alcohol and to have wine by the bottle rather than from the self service taps. Overall, not worth the extra in our opinion.
reviews.title: Wonderful new year in the sun:)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a week at the Princess Suites and what a week ...
reviews.title: Lovely hotel,entertainment not great
